dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, we've got some pretty significant security news coming out of Kazakhstan today.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, we've got some pretty significant security news coming out of Kazakhstan today.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. The National Security Committee, um, has been really active, especially around combating terrorism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. The National Security Committee, um, has been really active, especially around combating terrorism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. I mean, a big one is this resident in Shymkent, uh, who just got a pretty hefty sentence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. I mean, a big one is this resident in Shymkent, uh, who just got a pretty hefty sentence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a whopping seven years in prison, A. And get this, he was, like, actively encouraging people to commit murders, all based on, you know, religious grounds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a whopping seven years in prison, A. And get this, he was, like, actively encouraging people to commit murders, all based on, you know, religious grounds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A resident of Shymkent has been convicted of promoting terrorism and inciting murder... the city court sentenced him to 7 years in prison. As part of a criminal case investigated by the NSC, it was established that he encouraged those around him to commit murders and justified violence on religious grounds, the statement says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's incredibly disturbing. [interrupts] And it's not just that one case either, right? I saw something about Atyrau and Aktobe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's incredibly disturbing. And it's not just that one case either, right? I saw something about Atyrau and Aktobe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, definitely not. Two more individuals, um, were sentenced to seven and six years respectively in those regions. Again, for promoting terrorism among religious believers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, definitely not. Two more individuals, um, were sentenced to seven and six years respectively in those regions. Again, for promoting terrorism among religious believers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additionally, based on NSC materials, two individuals were sentenced to 7 and 6 years in prison by the courts of the Atyrau and Aktobe regions for promoting terrorism among religious believers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they actually had previous records, didn't they? Like, prior convictions?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they actually had previous records, didn't they? Like, prior convictions?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. Both had, uh, prior convictions for general criminal offenses. And, uh, they'd even tried to travel to areas of terrorist activity before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. Both had, uh, prior convictions for general criminal offenses. And, uh, they'd even tried to travel to areas of terrorist activity before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Both had previous convictions for general criminal offenses and attempts to travel to areas of terrorist activity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it sounds like the NSC is really, um, clamping down on this. What's the bigger picture looking like for this year so far?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it sounds like the N S C is really, um, clamping down on this. What's the bigger picture looking like for this year so far?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, since the start of the year, they've already convicted 52 individuals for terrorist and extremist crimes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, since the start of the year, they've already convicted fifty two individuals for terrorist and extremist crimes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the beginning of this year, 52 individuals, including two foreign nationals, have been convicted of terrorist and extremist crimes in criminal cases investigated by the NSC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fifty-two? That's a huge number. [interrupts] And I think I read, like, two of those were foreign nationals too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifty-two? That's a huge number. And I think I read, like, two of those were foreign nationals too, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the beginning of this year, 52 individuals, including two foreign nationals, have been convicted of terrorist and extremist crimes in criminal cases investigated by the NSC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You're absolutely right, B. Two foreign nationals included in that count.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're absolutely right, B. Two foreign nationals included in that count.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the beginning of this year, 52 individuals, including two foreign nationals, have been convicted of terrorist and extremist crimes in criminal cases investigated by the NSC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then there are even more investigations ongoing, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there are even more investigations ongoing, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, another 52 individuals are currently under investigation. So, um, their plate is definitely full.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, another fifty two individuals are currently under investigation. So, um, their plate is definitely full.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investigations are ongoing against another 52 individuals, the statement concludes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So it's not just, you know, isolated incidents. It's a really concerted effort from the NSC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So it's not just, you know, isolated incidents. It's a really concerted effort from the N S C.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It just shows, um, the scale of what they're dealing with there, continuously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It just shows, um, the scale of what they're dealing with there, continuously.
